comments:
I find that meta-models suddenly develop parse failures which I am unable to cure by rational means. The following is a strange, but I think consistent repro:

Using the EMF2KM3 example, run up Eclipse on the CVS of this morning, run up a nested Eclipse session, and run the EMF2KM3 transformation on Sample.ecore.
Then append (before the ">")

nsURI="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore" nsPrefix="ecore"

to the second line (ecore:EPackage) of Sample.ecore.
Save the edit.
Rerun the transformation - no problem.
Rerun the transformation - parse error in invoking console.

Sometimes undoing the edit reverts to no error.

If that fails to repro, try a few more simple edits such as new line
formatting to the ecore:EPackage line.

? Is a ResourceSet getting cached and so failing to refresh consistently
for changed edits. ?

It's the nsURI that does it:

adding

   nsURI="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2009/Ecore" nsPrefix="xyzzy"

causes no trouble but the correct URI:

   nsURI="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore" nsPrefix="xyzzy"

gives a parse error, which doesn't go away when changed back to

   nsURI="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2009/Ecore" nsPrefix="xyzzy"

Parse error is:

org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.ClassNotFoundException: Class 'EPackage' not found. (platform:/resource/Translator/QVT/qvtbase.ecore, 5, 34)
